timeline.message:
Improve OLAP queries for BerkeleyDB

Introduce CACHE_MODE parameters
Avoid interruption if store unsupported it

Signed-off-by: Pavel Ershov <owner.mad.epa@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Issue found: An instanceof check is being performed on the caught exception.  Create a separate catch clause for this exception type.
timeline.author: FlorianHockmann

replies.bodyText: I add another fix for that. PermanentBackendException will be contains in Throwable cause but not direct exception
replies.author: mad

timeline.bodyText: It would be good to know all possibilities here.
timeline.author: farodin91
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -67,6 +67,11 @@
             "The BDB record lock mode used for read operations",
             ConfigOption.Type.MASKABLE, String.class, LockMode.DEFAULT.toString(), disallowEmpty(String.class));
 
+    public static final ConfigOption<String> CACHE_MODE =
+        new ConfigOption<>(BERKELEY_NS, "cache-mode",
+            "Modes that can be specified for control over caching of records in the JE in-memory cache",
+            ConfigOption.Type.MASKABLE,  String.class, CacheMode.DEFAULT.toString(), disallowEmpty(String.class));

replies.bodyText: I don't think this possibilities will be useful, because it is internal modes of bdb and for understanding it required consult with javadoc
replies.author: mad
